page.title: 02Shrimping and Shore
page.content: The best times for shrimping are mid-August to Christmas and from April to July. Southport beach is good for shrimping because the water is sandy. Every catch varies in weight: it could be 3oz to 5lb depending on the weather. The first stage of shrimping is attaching two large poles to the tractor onto which the nets' ropes are fixed. The materials used for the nets are Corline twine and wood. After being caught the shrimps are riddled twice, firstly to get rid of the crabs and secondly to sort out smaller shrimps. Then they are washed, boiled and shelled. Around 30 people go shrimping in Southport in 1985, but in the early 1900's there were around 300 people. The sea wall was built in 1965. Southport beach used to be cleaner but now there are a lot of alluvial deposits from the R.Ribble.
